intro: Stenactis glauca, commonly known as the blue-green sea anemone, is a marine invertebrate belonging to the family Actinidiidae. It is characterized by its translucent, bluish-green body and long, delicate tentacles that surround its oral disc. This species is typically found in shallow coastal waters, where it attaches itself to rocky substrates. Its unique coloration and delicate structure make it an important part of marine ecosystems. Stenactis glauca plays a role in providing habitat and food for various small marine organisms.
